name: India: History and Culture 2 Quiz | Asian | 10 Questions

questions.text: A mosque was built in 1528 in Ayodhya by the Mughal emperor Babur much to the unhappiness of the Hindu population. The source of Hindu anger came as a result of the fact that many believed the mosque was built on the site of a ruined temple that was the birthplace of what figure of Indian history?
questions.explanation:
Rama.

	Yes, this was a freebie if you took the first India-related quiz. It always helps to pay attention!

questions.text: What is the name of the citadel of Sikhism, found in the holy city of Amritsar?
What is the native term for the Hindu caste system?
What is the home state of the Sikhs?
questions.explanation:
Punjab.

	The Punjab is currently divided between Pakistan and India, a source of contention.

questions.text: Kshatriya is the caste that historically included which group of people?
What is the lowest of the four Varna?
questions.explanation:
Sudras.

	The Sudras are the common people, agriculturalists and artisans.

questions.text: The Untouchables in India now refer to themselves as 'Dalits', which translates as what in English?
Which of the following is not a language of the Dravidian family?
questions.explanation:
Bengali.

	The Dravidian languages are concentrated in the south of India.

questions.text: The British East India Company was founded during the reign of what Mughal emperor?
questions.explanation:
Akbar.

	It was founded in 1600. Akbar reigned from 1556-1605.

questions.text: Pondicherry, on the southeast coast of India, was a colony of which European power?
